Journal Story: read thousands of entries - how hard can it be
trying an entry on a phone may need to dump the screen protector
should be in NC for the snow - checking out/ testing gear, instead of up north, warm with no snow - instead, I guess I could just carry a bunch of extra stuff for "just in case"

sitting by the fire drinking cocoa and schnapps, easy day today in nice hiking conditions - 2 young guys out seem to have the same pace, 3 mice so far- early start tomorrow to try and optimize conditions

have a photo of the empty TP rack at woody gap, but cannot figure how to post - no one to change it with the shutdown - nice day, many on the trail, one of the finishing sobos, I had met in Maine - shower at neals was nice

Trail follows the ridge, at dusk - on the right the lights of a distant town, on the left the clouds/ fog has settled into the valley making a gentle white glow against the backdrop of the dark ridges in the distance- you do not get this in season, the leaves are on and you cannot see squat

so, I get asked if I will make it all the way - from what I understand the most important factor is to be pretty - no doubt I have an excellent chance
   Sobo’s are exact opposite of Nobo, they start with the hardest in Maine and finish with easy GA - Nobo starts easy in GA / finishes tough in Maine
  obviously then, the most important thing for a sobo to reach Springer is to be ugly - it is only 2-3 days away from here so of course, at this point the sobo’s making it are quite ugly - when I encounter them I say: you are so great, let me take your picture - but the camera is on selfie mode and I am actually admiring my self, and taking a few photos- this helps to avoid looking at the hideous sobo’s.... now if I could only figure out how to avoid smelling them
winter is hot in GA - tomorrow will be a state that begins with north so should not be melting like a stick of butter

NC got hit hard, snow is almost all gone but the damage remains - in the valleys the rhoto thickets are mashed down - the trail under basically ceases to exist, if the prohibition on trail work continues, it will get interesting when the hoard attempts to pass
better trail today

noc is a big place with a lot of services and does not close down, but the hours are cut - need a fuel cylinder and got in after the close for the outfitter, tomorrow it says yearly inventory - hopefully they will sell me one anyway
especially with the leaves off, the wind, sun and terrain make for a lot of quick changing perceived temp - best clothing choices allow plenty of change without removing the pack
coming down to Fontana the flag was prominent- would not even see it with the leaves on - into the park tomorrow, no service/ posts for a while
there is service on the ridge and a nice fire at the shelter by some week long hikers

a few days of character builder weather - to the person who wanted a little more, come on out and join me - then you will get it all - I will say this, daily it is out of the dark, into the dark or both, and twice so far I have walked to midnight - is’nt life great?
came by clingmans, highest point on AT, so from there it is more down hill than up - short day today, worked on drying gear
in the smokies, 2 of the shelters are 1/2 mi off the AT - and if you use one it lines you up for the other, so 2 extra miles - there is a few hundred calories expended that you will never get back
being a flat lander, who had never flown, the first time I was above the clouds was at Spence field with some fellow cave men - near Cosby today, there were many overlooks above the clouds again
other than a few short sections no bikes on the AT, bu for most of the day there was bike track over snow etc, I have to say the riders were pretty bad ass
up and down the hills, I was passing back and forth through the zones of snow, sleet, rain and freezing rain - made for an interesting day

too much food coming out of town made for a slow short day, ended up better since the next shelter has little wind protection - another north bound distance hiker in the area to commiserate the coming weather
missed this day
got a shuttle to a hostel for the cold night
they wanted 50$ for back to the exit point so we got on near the hostel - 2 nights in a row inside, for shame
Hiking now with a young guy I named the graduate - telling stories and jokes leaves less time to think of what to put here
tough one, lot of ice on roan high knob, finished in rain/ dark but at least in an enclosed shelter

third time on roam mt that the wind was trying to knock me over —  to mark waligora, my gear lessons learned so far would to be able to deal with 35 and rain wearing all quik/ easy dry synthetics and beef up rain protection - 2 potential changes: swap down puffy for similar synthetic, swap wind shirt for OR helium rain jacket, other than that gear choices are holding up
of anywhere on the trail I have spent the most nights at kincora - most like home, hung out talking to bob till mid afternoon

nice day, easy trail, great scenery 3rd night in a row inside - what has become of the early season conditions I was used to ??  - to Fred: The only other gear tweaking I anticipate is changing to a foam pad in Damascus, the neoair has a tiny leak that I can not find
mostly today was an arc around the lake, seldom was it out of sight for long
was time to make some miles before the weather turns and nice trail to do it on
tough weather at home required assistance
Actually just a couple of hitches, bus and expensive car rental to replace a canceled portion - not close to the drama of the movie
tried to set up a tent for a better test, the frozen ground was too hard - but 8F in the screen room gave my gear confirmation

might as well regear, the coldest potential has passed, was using a negative 5 setup will go to +5Exos 58 pack      40FF 10 bag           36Foam pad           9Winter bivy         7Fleece+ down pants 17Synthetic+ down puffies 28Base pants+ t shirt Rainwear.        20Socks.             14Gloves + hats.  16Shorts+ underwear 6Stick.                 9Shoes.                28Kitchen+ water bottles 52Instep spikes.       6Stuff sacks.           3TP + electrics etc 40Liquids.         50Food.            144Base.   17 lbSkin out 34Pack wt. 29About 7 lb less than previous gear set
